channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Fri, 25 Oct 2024 09:44:00 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Play by the rules': Why Vivek Ramaswamy is pushing for single-day nationwide voting
item.description: At a rally with Donald Trump, Vivek Ramaswamy proposed single-day nationwide voting with paper ballots and government ID. He urged Republicans to participate in early voting to secure a win, comparing the 2024 election to the American Revolution and Trump to George Washington.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk fuels Trump campaign with $44 million super PAC donation
item.description: Elon Musk donated $44 million to a pro-Trump super PAC in early October, bringing his total contributions to $75 million. The funds are part of efforts to boost voter turnout in key states for the upcoming election. Concerns arise as Musk's $1 million daily giveaways may violate federal law, sparking Justice Department scrutiny.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If you wanted to avoid nuclear war then vote ...': How Robert F Kennedy Jr endorsed Trump
item.description: Politician Robert F Kennedy Jr. urges voters to support Donald Trump to avoid nuclear war, claiming Kamala Harris' presidency would lead to conflict. He criticizes Dick Cheney's endorsement of Harris, drawing parallels with past military interventions and highlighting concerns over Harris' foreign policy experience and potential influence by military factions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is fascism? And why does Harris say Trump is a fascist?
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris labels Donald Trump as a fascist, pointing to his admiration of dictators and use of totalitarian tactics. Experts are divided, with some seeing Trump moving towards fascist tendencies, while others believe the label is exaggerated given stronger US democratic institutions.

item.title: Man pleads guilty to displaying a Nazi symbol at pro-Palestinian rally
item.description: Alan Yazbek has pleaded guilty to displaying a Nazi symbol during a pro-Palestinian rally in Sydney on October 6. He faces potential jail time or a fine. The rally gathered around 10,000 attendees, and Jewish groups report a rise in anti-Semitic incidents in Australia amid Middle East tensions.

item.title: A car bomb explodes outside a police station in western Mexico, wounding 3 officers
item.description: A car bomb attack outside a police station in Acambaro, Guanajuato, wounds three people, including a woman and her daughter. Another explosion in Jerecuaro causes significant damage but no injuries. These attacks are linked to ongoing cartel violence, challenging new President Sheinbaum's policy of avoiding direct confrontation with drug cartels.

item.title: Israel kills Mohammad Abu Itiwi, Hamas commander involved in October 7 attack
item.description: Israel's military killed Hamas commander Mohammad Abu Itiwi, who was involved in the Oct 7, 2023, attack on southern Israel and employed by UNRWA. The Israeli military had alerted UNRWA about suspected affiliations of their staff with armed groups, escalating tensions between Israel and the agency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Menendez brothers: Prosecutor urges resentencing, parole in 1989 parents' murder case
item.description: The Menendez brothers may become eligible for parole after District Attorney George Gascón suggested resentencing for their 1989 conviction for murdering their parents. New evidence, including a letter by Erik Menendez alleging sexual abuse by their father, has reignited the case. Gascón emphasized the consideration of abuse claims, recommending 50 years to life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lawsuit accusing Roman Polanski of 1973 rape settled
'Bangladesh situation does not warrant India's visa curbs'
Ready to consider any options to end conflict in Ukraine, but based on reality: Russia president
Trump receives Purple Heart medal from war veteran despite ex-president famously known for avoiding military duty
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump received a Purple Heart from war veteran John Ford as gratitude for Trump's perceived contributions and injuries sustained. This occurred after an alleged assassination attempt against Trump. This isn't the first time Trump has been given such an honor by veterans, leading to mixed reactions from the public and experts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Within two seconds': Trump vows to fire the special counsel who indicted if re-elected
item.description: Former President Donald Trump vowed to fire special counsel Jack Smith within 'two seconds' if re-elected, following Smith's federal indictments against him for election interference and mishandling classified documents. Trump, confident he wouldn't face impeachment, called Smith 'crooked.' Trump's allies assert Smith's appointment was illegal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stealth version of the far left': Comedian Bill Maher advises Kamala Harris against posing herself as 'woke President'
item.description: Comedian Bill Maher suggests that Vice President Kamala Harris must convince voters she is not aligned with extreme leftist views to appeal to undecided voters. Maher advises against presenting as a 'woke' candidate, noting the term's evolving meaning. Harris has adjusted her stance on several policies since her 2020 campaign, while maintaining consistent values.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYU family weekend: Will there be anyone for Barron Trump?
item.description: New York University is hosting its alumni and family weekend at Washington Square Park, where the family members of the freshman students are likely to turn up. As many celebrity kids attend NYU, the event is likely to become a star-studded affair but it is highly unlikely that Barron Trump's parents will attend the event and Trump is busy in election preparation and Melania with her book events.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why was Amazon's Alexa giving pro-Kamala responses? Company informs house judiciary committee
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Neither Kamala nor Trump...': Pollster predicts election outcome that hasn't happened in 36 years
item.description: GOP pollster Mitchell Brown predicts neither Donald Trump nor Kamala Harris will win all three key battleground states — Michigan, Wisconsin, and Pennsylvania. The race remains tight with a potential Trump victory if he takes one of these states. Analysts are divided, with polls predicting a competitive contest. "What I see here, is that neither candidate would win all three of those, that means Trump just taking one—he has the election won," Brown said on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bizarre! Missouri man lived with 175 cats, daughter was not allowed to enter
item.description: In Missouri's St. Louis County, an elderly man was forced to leave his home after his daughter discovered he was living in squalor with 175 cats. The daughter gained access to the house after her mother passed away, revealing the deplorable conditions. The daughter said a relative came to stay with their parents who blocked everyone's entry to the house and that went on for years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump says he may pardon Hunter Biden because...
item.description: Former President Donald Trump stated in an interview that he would consider pardoning Hunter Biden, the first child of a sitting president to be convicted of a crime. ​"See, unlike Joe Biden, despite what they’ve done to me, where they’ve gone after me so viciously, despite what — and Hunter’s a bad boy. There’s no question about it. He’s been a bad boy. All you had to do is see the laptop from hell. But I happen to think it’s very bad for our country," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris book author attacks her faith: 'Vengeful Hindu goddess'
item.description: "I was raised to believe in a loving God, to believe that your faith is a verb, live your faith," Kamala Harris told Anderson Cooper as her faith is a much-discussed issue this election after the Donald Trump campaign called her 'anti-Christ'. Kamala Harris said she prays every day and sometimes twice a day and when President Joe Biden withdrew from the race endorsing her, she called her pastor Reverend Amos C. Brown of the Third Baptist Church of San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
